item.title: Bolero hosting Razor page
item.description: In this post we investigate how to use Razor pages on the host and Bolero WebAssembly on the client side. The final code can be found on My github - Tutorials - BoleroAppRazor.

item.title: Github resources
item.description: Some of my codes are documented on my Github with description in the readme files. Take a look there. Github Description BoleroApp A simple Bolero app with file upload and data repository using dependency injection StringAlgorithms Some string algorithms in F# to measure string similarity WebAPI A net7.

item.title: Input file element with Bolero
item.description: Bolero is a set of free and open-source libraries and tools to write web applications in F#. With it, you can write fully dynamic client-side web applications from the comfort of a strongly-typed functional language, all with great performance.

item.title: Static templating with handlebars, liquid and others
item.description: Templating is an proofen method to create static web pages. Typically, you write your html pages and fill in some parameters at page assembly time.

item.title: Bolero Hints
item.description: This blog contains some experiences working with Bolero. Bolero is a set of free and open-source libraries and tools to write web applications in F#.

item.description: Once in a while, I’m supporting Lea with her math homework (Swiss: Uffzgi). Here are some tools that help me (remember, that I prefer F# to other languages.

item.title: WebSharper simple inputs
item.description: This post shows various ways to handle input using WebSharper. Client side There are two basic approaches: using HTML templates or using Websharper’s HTML.

item.title: WebSharper templates
item.description: WebSharper allows several ways to instatiate HTML, and It took me some thinking to get these terms right: ws-replace ws-hole ws-template ws-template-children Replace Replace the given node with the provided string or list of docs.

item.title: WebSharper shopping cart
item.description: Websharper Shopping cart I found an interesting article from 2020 by Adam Granizc on the implementation of a WebSharper shopping cart in WebSharper Shopping Cart

item.title: Using Jekyll
item.description: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes.
